title: Is there such a thing as a melee adc?
body: I'm not questioning the logic behind no melee adc's but I'm just wondering if there is a viable melee adc?

replies.body: Morde is the closest thing but you need the right support like bard or thresh.

I don't know about Varus, but Lucian falls off late game in comparison to others in his role, but not overall.

He's still more useful to his team late game than most juggernauts, if not any of them.

ADCs are unique because they, as a rule, scale well into late game. Some just scale even more well into late game, like Vayne or Twitch. 

By comparison, top has genuinely awful late game champions like Pantheon, and formidable late game carries like Fiora or Riven.

More to the point, I'm okay with some juggernauts scaling poorly into late game. My problem is that they ALL do. Compare to the diver subclass, which has early game powerhouses like Pantheon, and late game badasses like Camille.
No, melee adcs are skirmishers.
Why are you bringing the new subclasses into this? Yasuo and Mordekaiser (his rework that is) were deliberately designed to be botlaners. This has nothing to do with the new classification.

And they no longer are balanced around going bot, so your information is quite irrelevant. Melee adcs are actually skirmishers, because it's attack damage, not melee bot. Mordekaiser isn't ad. Melee adc refers to melee champions that build like traditional ADCs.
You have no clue about what "past tense" means, uh?

Most of the classic definitions of Melee ADC's, Riot has defined as Skirmishers. Mainly Yasuo, Tryndamere, and Master Yi.

Like Marksman, they should be more item dependent and less level dependent. Which would be ideal for a Duo laner. The only issue is that the Marksman will constantly out harass, out push, and out bully the melee counterpart. 

Yet these champs do make their homes either in the Solo Lane, Or in the Jungle. But because of that, it's difficult to give them any additional tools to counter range, that won't just make them even stronger where they are currently.

'Auto-attack damage carry' is how adc is usually interpreted. My opinion is that most of these types of champions would work well with Leona bot lane (assuming they are forced into that one) provided that the combo can quickly and repeatedly farm minions under their own turret fire should they fall behind and be forced to do so. This can be problematic in many situations even with standard marksmen adcs but it is usually safer.

(Insert shyvana)

Very few ADCs have higher DPS than Yasuo. Only like one potentially has higher than Tryndamere. Not one ADC in the entire game has higher DPS than Master Yi.

Depends on how you define "ADC" tbh
If you mean any main damage source with physical damage type, then yeah, there are a ton.
If you mean marksmen, who use ranged autos while kiting to do their damage, then by definition, no.

Then there are champions who rely on AA for damage at close range, with other powerful defensive capabilities to compensate for the range. These include Yasuo, Master Yi, Fiora, Jax, etc. Official term is skirmisher.
Skirmishers.

People have made it work. You gotta be prepared to take a lot of potential poke in lane, and need some way to farm in spite of that fact. 

Off the top of my head, the streamer Yassuo occasionally plays Yasuo as an ADC, with specific supports. But he's a very skilled player, so results may vary wildly.
you can play tryndamere bot lane in certain scenarios, but your team will need to buy void gates for siege later
